record.Creator: enzo prathamesh shinde
record.Title: Vinci
record.Text: Story Video: Instagram: @vincimotorbikeThe design for the VINCI Electric Motorbike is based on research that shows the most comfortable riding position for a motorcycle. This research defines the ideal dimensions for the location of the seat, handlebars, and foot pedals to achieve the most comfortable riding position. This video shows a person who is 6ft tall riding the VINCI Electric Motorbike. For me, it was never about getting from point A to point B; it was about how I got there.Riding a bike creates that feeling of my adrenaline rushing and my dopamine spiking.My first connection with a bike was when I was 16. I took that my cousin's bike to open an empty back street, and I still remember that sensation.I am not reinventing electric bikes. There are plenty of them available in the market.But I didn't want to have a lame electric bike with some electronics slapped on a regular bike, or an older Bonanza mini bike frame. I wanted something special.Since I was a kid, I have been obsessed with cars and bikes, and sketching them. This bike design is my favorite and I have been planning it for a very long time.After studying and working in mechanical engineering, I finally gained the necessary skills to bring my favorite bike to life.I wanted to get around town in style, so I chose components that have enough power, can get me through the daily commute and have some extra power leftover to have fun, and of course, it had to be street legal. I wanted to design a bike that speaks to me that ties together simple, clean and timeless design. The bike that I would like to keep forever.As an artist, I came up with a design that satisfies my requirements of style and comfort, and now I want to share this design with the world.As the most trusted product launch company in the world, Enventys Partners has helped launch over 2,000 innovations with global sales of over $1 Billion dollars for our clients.By utilizing 20 years of experience in:Got an idea? We would love to help you launch it.

record.Creator: Stefan Voit
record.Title: 3D Druck Vaporizer „Smoother“
record.Text:
3D Druck, ist super, aber nirgendwo gibt es ein günstiges Gerät um sein ABS oder ABS-like Material nachzuarbeiten bzw. das ganze Potenzial herauszuholen.

Ein Vaporizer, Verdampfer, Bedampfer, „ABS mit Aceton-Verfeinerer“ oder eben ein „Smoother“ wäre hierfür das Richtige.

Ich habe so ein Gerät gebaut, bzw. ein erster Prototyp ist bereits vorhanden. Im "Gerät" wird Aceton erwärmt und verdampft, was dazu führt, dass die Dämpfe des Aceton das ABS “angreifen“ und nach einer kurzen Zeit das Bauteil so glätten, dass es einen Glanz und eine Weichzeichnung erhält, die nicht mehr an 3D-Druck erinnern. Die Unterseite wird dabei aber nur weniger behandelt.


Für die Hobbyanwendung kann das Gerät/ der Smoother m.E. einfacher sein, soll aber trotzdem gute Resultate erzielen und für jeden kostengünstig zur Verfügung stehen.


Genau das will ich euch bereitstellen und dabei zuerst ein professionelleres Gehäuse bauen. 
Weiter steht bereits ein Konzept mit Einbindung von Elektronik- und IT Spezialisten in Planung.

Gesamt-Ziel ist, mit möglichst viel Unterstützung ein Produkt herzustellen, das von der Qualität an das im Grunde einzig verfügbare Gerät am Markt anknüpfen kann, aber extrem günstiger ist (6000€ versus 150-250€) und somit für die breite Masse, d.h. Hobbyanwender, zugänglich ist.

record.Creator: EmbodyMe
record.Title: xpression camera: breaking the mold of virtual communication
record.Text: xpression camera is an award winning virtual camera app which enables users to redefine their onscreen persona in real time using cutting edge technology. Whether you’re just not quite camera ready, a seasoned content creator, or simply inspired to change your look, the app empowers you to instantly transform your likeness and take full control of your digital narrative.Since its inception, xpression camera has been inspiring people around the globe to reinvent their image while chatting on apps like Zoom, live streaming on Twitch, or creating content on YouTube.In 2020, our team of engineers endeavored to create a foundational virtual camera platform that is not only entertaining, but practically useful in any setting and for anyone, whether you’re seeking a breath of fresh air–a much needed reprieve from the constant glare of the webcam lens during stressful work meetings, want to put your best face forward in an online class, produce intriguing video content for social media, pursue your own creative project, or chat with family and friends.What possibilities arise when you can be free of worry over a cluttered background, or not wearing make-up during your daily meetings?Or if you could appear in a suit on camera and in actuality be wearing pajamas?The app’s essential aim gives you the opportunity to reinvent yourself in digital form, and establish your footing within the technologically advanced world on our horizon.xpression camera's powerful and innovative technology also functions as a creator platform, supporting an array of meme, gif, cinematic, and social content generators throughout their journeys, from image and video sourcing to creation, with professional tools that help you produce original content to share with friends, business associates, and followers alike. Our 3D Dense Face Tracking technology is trained to recognize the face’s precise shape and expressions of the face while simultaneously honing in on over fifty thousand 3-dimensional points.Our Neural Rendering technology generates natural looking images modeled after the original. With xpression camera, the process of recognizing the source image and the user's face, as well as producing visual components is all done within 0.01 seconds, ensuring a real time in-app experience.We are developing technology that will allow users to animate images and videos using just voice or text recordings, which will introduce two new mediums through which you can create content while using xpression camera. These features will eliminate the need for users to utilize a web camera while they record themselves and allow for increased flexibility. So if you happen to be doing household chores, partaking in childcare duties, or even jogging, for example, you can still seamlessly enjoy the app.We are also developing technology that can control the movements of the entire body with the intent to integrate this feature into future versions of xpression camera. With the current app, only the upper half of the body can be manipulated, but we’re working towards giving users the ability to animate the movements of the entire body of the likeness that they present on screen.This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them. This project is powered by Kickbooster, the first and only tool made specifically for crowdfunders to manage their affiliate, referral, and influencer network all in one place.Our Ethical Commitmentxpression camera was developed by a team of pioneering engineers dedicated to promoting a healthy and imaginative community centered on AI driven content, because we believe in a future of unbound creativity, powered by deep learning. We strongly support the ethical and socially responsible use of our technology.

record.Creator: Darius Safavi
record.Title: DRIVETOGETHER
record.Text:
I am Darius. I offer to bring people, sharing the same route, together to make one out of several cars with a modern and user-friendly App. Within a simple interface, i will offer rides that are cheap for passengers and beneficial for drivers. Unlike other providers, it shouldn't be about generating as much as possible as a driver, but rather about DRIVE-TOGETHER. About a trip that I will take one way or another so that people from my surrounding area who want to drive the same route at the same time may be taken with me.To kick off the idea i would like to start in Amsterdam, involve local app developers and marketing companies. To help us build up a user-friendly app, promote it and make it freely accessible for everyone. I will offer a choice of different incentives that will be coupled to a mile program (bonus per ride and kilometer) for passengers and drivers.
 These incentives will offer the driver compensation for detours. Passengers without a car or public traffic card will have the possibility to generate free spontaneous rides. All incentives are accessible for drivers and passengers.

record.Creator: Impartial
record.Title: Myriad: The Electric Car Company
record.Text: Motivation : Freedom and SavingsWe all know that the fossil fuel market is controlled by a handfull of people, that is why everyone is going electric.Electric vehicles are less expensive to fuel than gasoline powered vehicles. The average person drives between 10,000 and 15,000 miles and spends between $1,300 and $1,900 on gasoline per year. In comparison, the cost of electricity to power Myriad over the same distance is up to four times lower. Over the six year average length of car ownership, that's between $5,500 and $8,200 in gasoline savings.We've assumed a fuel economy of 21 miles per gallon for a comparable gasoline powered premium sedan. We've also assumed the national average of $0.13 per kilowatt-hour for electricity, 10% charging on Tesla’s Supercharger network and $2.85 per gallon for premium gasoline over the next six years.Our first car will be a SUV with solar pannel roof. It will have a 2673 mm wheelbase, it will be 4500 mm long, 1650 mm wide , 1750 tall.It will be available in 2 configurations , one single motor with rear wheel drive and one dual motor with AWD.The single motor version will be equipped with 85 kWh battery pack and the dual motor with 100 kWh battery pack.The power produced will be arround 400 hp for the single motor and 520 hp for the dual motor.Now we are at the stage of merging the software and hardware together.We dont have a working prototype so we cant show it to you.We have renders of how we wish the car to look but we cant share them because of kickstarter`s policy. Maybe we will be able to add them in an update.Thank you!

record.Creator: Jason Clarke
record.Title: Dating 4.0 - The Only Dating App You Need - No More Swiping!
record.Text: Click here to view a slide deck (email required) Hi, my name is Jay Clarke•Over the years my life has taken me across many countries and multiple cities – Cardiff, Swansea, London, Newcastle, Brighton, Sydney, The Gold Coast, The Sunshine Coast, Perth, Adelaide, Brisbane, Bangkok, Kiev, St Petersburg (Russia), Tokyo, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shanghai, and Ho Chi Minh City, and a few more.•What I have realised is that during that period of work and travel, my hobby of meeting people from online services in my spare time has become something that I hold expertise in.•My ability to apply knowledge and experience to be able to near guarantee a good offline meeting from an online service has become one of my biggest assets.•Arriving back to the UK in August 2021, I realised it was time to pursue my one true passion – to build the best dating app in the world.•There is no doubt in my mind that I can build the best app that would be available in the market by a significant margin. I am utterly flabbergasted that daters have been left with tinder as our main option for such a long time.•The swipe novelty was great at its launch but over the years it has taken a toll, with poor innovation and then a monopoly forming in the market, explained later.•It is time for change.•The dating market is for the big boys. Big investment reaps huge rewards. It is impossible to launch something half-heartedly.•To win in this market you have to compete with the Americans using their rules…big pre-seed and seed funding, big valuations, big sales.•I bring this presentation to you to seek investment to bring significant income, employment opportunities and funds to make charitable contributions for our communities.A slide deck for this appeal is presented here; Slide Deck

record.Creator: Kniterate
record.Title: Kniterate: The Digital Knitting Machine
record.Text: Kniterate is bringing an affordable and compact version of industrial knitting machines to your workshop. It automatically turns your digital designs into knitted garments.We’ve made the process of designing and making knitwear very easy. Start creating scarves, beanies, ties, ready to be worn and assembling your own dresses, sweaters or even shoes.Create a design and Kniterate will knit it for you. Our process makes it easy for you to scale from one-offs to production quantities. Read the section How Kniterate works for details.We love knitwear. It’s light and breathable, adapts to your body and unlike cut-and-sew, there is almost no waste, because the product is knitted to shape. We have developed Kniterate because we want everyone to be able to explore knitting’s potential. Until now the only similar tools available were industrial knitting machines, which cost upwards of $50,000, take a lot of space and require a technician to run. With Kniterate you can make personalized professional knitwear at the click of a button, and repeat and share your favorite designs over and over again.     Domestic knitting machines from the 80s work with punch cards and tasks like casting on, casting off, shaping, cable knitting, etc. can take hours of painstaking work -- and it only gets more complicated when you add colors.   Like an industrial knitting machine, Kniterate is computer-controlled. It can transfer stitches around and do these tasks automatically, freeing you up to do more creative work.Kniterate bridges both worlds with an easy to use automatic digital knitting machine adapted to suit the budget of makers and designers and sized for any studio, makerspace or class.  With a library of templates and up to six feeders (different colors and/or materials), you will be able to make amazing patterns, structures and shapes that would be hard to knit otherwise.           This is the perfect machine for small fashion businesses and design studios, makerspaces and schools.Its applications go beyond knitwear, ranging from medical devices and aerospace components to technical apparel and sports equipment. Imagine having a tool to prototype the new generation of wearables!With Kniterate, you can create custom knitted products like scarves, beanies, shoe uppers, sweaters, dresses, and more. Just follow these three easy steps:    .The Kniterate software is currently under development and will ship free with the knitting machine. There will be a browser-based version and a standalone version (Mac and Windows compatible), the files will be loaded onto the machine via an SD card or USB.An online library of templates will be integrated into the design app, so that you can design, edit and share your garments and accessories. The UI will let you:The design app in the video below is not fully functional yet. We show it as a way to demonstrate what we are working on.The design app shown in the video below is functional but still a bit rough around the edges. (A little steam will smooth out the wavy edges of the scarf).Capabilities that have been developed so far:We'll keep this list updated with our progress. We are currently working on the algorithms for shaping garments. As soon as the design app is more robust we will make it public to our backers only, for review and feedback.The design app generates a set of low-level instructions to run the the machine called K-code, that describe any set of operations it can undertake. The easy to use design app is able to output this K-code so you don’t have to worry about anything, it integrates seamlessly with Kniterate. Although, since it was designed to be readable and writable by a human, we are publishing its specifications here.   Our free software will allow designers, artists, illustrators and makers to grow our platform by sharing their work.You will be able to explore templates from your favourite designers and Kniterate will knit them for you.We can’t wait to start engaging with our community to build the best Kniterate experience. We wanted to make it easy for everyone to organize a way to reach more people and help them pledge for Kniterate. To do this we have created the Made in the Neighborhood program.  We have developed countless prototypes, and although the machine works perfectly and all the information we’ve given you is based on this model, we want to make a lighter and faster machine. That’s why we are giving ourselves four months to optimize it and test it before manufacturing.To manufacture Kniterate we have partnered with an industrial knitting machine manufacturer that has over 30 years of experience.The factory has thoroughly reviewed our design for manufacturing (DFM), Bill of Materials (BOM), as well as the production plan, giving us a quote and manufacturing times.Our target shipping date is April 2018.We will not charge your shipping during the campaign. Shipping prices vary by location and country. It’s simpler (and cheaper for you) to handle this separately and it allows you to spread the costs. It's also the most equitable way to treat each of our backers.After the Kickstarter is over and we are ready to start shipping, you will receive an invitation to go to our website and enter your shipping information to pay the appropriate amount.Gerard Rubio started this project four years ago and assembled a team which has worked tirelessly to bring you Kniterate.Barcelona, Spain At design school Gerard watched fashion students struggle with old knitting machines. Having worked building 3D printers years before, he had the idea for OpenKnit.  Gerard kept working on it and he made the project public in 2014 with the video below:Shenzhen, China  Gerard assembled a team and was selected for the HAX accelerator in Shenzhen, China to develop the machine. HAX is the first and largest hardware accelerator, and has one of the most selective programs in the world. Shenzhen is the electronics manufacturing capital of the world.                        In January 2016, we moved there with 14 other HAX teams. We spent four incredible months working hard to develop a Kniterate prototype to take to Maker Faire Bay Area.Zhejian, China  To make a machine that knits professional quality products and to deliver the rewards on time, we’ve partnered with a family-owned knitting machine manufacturer with 30 years of experience. We spent the summer of 2016 living in their factory.By merging our team’s energy and creativity with the operational excellence of a Chinese industrial knitting machine manufacturer, we will be able to work with confidence in delivering the rewards of this campaign.Gerard Rubio holds degrees in Film Direction and Media Design. He co-founded blablabLAB, an art collective. Two award-winning projects developed during that period, Be Your Own Souvenir and Haberlandt, took him to numerous conferences and exhibitions around the world. You may remember him from OpenKnit.Triambak Saxena worked as a molecular biologist, with research published in the field of plant science. This was before he decided to study finance and practice the craft of the spreadsheet at Kniterate. He had previously collaborated with Gerard in blablabLAB.Tom Catling has a background in 3D printing and scientific instrumentation. He met Gerard and Triambak whilst doing a PhD at UCL, and has also worked as a hardware designer with several other Kickstarter and open source projects.Jinhee Park graduated from the Bunka Fashion College in Japan and is currently studying fashion knit in the London College of Fashion. As an intern in Kniterate she helped design much of the knitwear at Kniterate.Héctor Anadón Héctor made his first 3D printer even before starting his degree in Aerospace Engineering. He hasn't stopped shipping new things since then.Daniel Carmona has a background in Aerospace Engineering and 3D printing software. He is now a FullStack web developer.  We didn’t do this alone. We would like to thanks to all of you for making this possible: We have spent many hours developing Kniterate and are now ready to move into production. To make this happen we need your support. A pledge of any amount, however small, will mean a lot to us: We can’t wait to offer you the means to create and share your own customized knits. We know you are going to come up with ideas that we can’t even think of, and we are really excited about it!We will be updating our FAQ here and in this spreadsheet.Kniterate.com

record.Creator: Vaonis
record.Title: Vespera: The new way to observe the universe
record.Text: Vespera is your exploration station, the perfect combination of a telescope and a camera.Smart and fully automated, it is a revolution in the world of Astronomy. We completely redesigned the experience of observation by opting for the most comfortable eyepiece: your mobile device combined with our app. You can now access the wonders of the Universe with ease.Thanks to Vespera, you can explore and observe the night sky, capture your own photos of celestial objects, learn about the Cosmos, and share your discoveries all in one place.Super easy to use, just set up the tripod using the adjustable legs, and press the button. Let Vespera come to life and calibrate itself through the GPS of your device and our Star Field Recognition technology. Using the app, select the object you want to observe, and Vespera will point and track it. Even charging Vespera is as simple as this: Our app is your space center, the place where you decide where you want to go. Very intuitive and user friendly, you can easily access any stellar object in our catalog.You will also get personalized recommendations on what to observe according to your geolocation and the astronomical calendar.You will beguided each step of the way on your journey to reach the stars.Have you ever dreamed of photographing the Cosmos? Vespera integrates the technology allowing you to observe and shoot deep-sky objects effortlessly. You can now memorialize galaxies, nebulae and so much more.Here’s what you can do with Vespera. Equipped with the best components on the market, Vespera is a gem of technology.Quadruplet Apochromatic RefractorThere are two kinds of telescopes: reflectors (mirrors) and refractors (lenses). Mirrors need to be adjusted very often when refractors keep a perfect alignment during all their life. To avoid any optical default, we developed our home made optical design based on 4 lenses in 2 groups. This system is one of the best on the market: 0 distortion, 0 chromatic aberration, 0 astigmatism. Vespera guaranties you the sharpest stars for many years and the perfect optic to follow you wherever you go! Sony sensorThe latest Sony sensors have an incredible sensitivity in low light. That is the reason why we chose them to provide the best sensor for Vespera. However, a sensor is not enough. We developed our own electronic card to make sure that heat management stays optimal. A hot sensor means a lot of defaults, so our sensor board is designed to dissipate the maximum amount of heat.Image processing algorithmLike our previous product, we worked in partnership with the Raspberry Pi computer manufacturer to guarantee you the best software & hardware performances. We embed the last Raspberry Pi technologies, working with our patented image processing algorithm to get the best of the Sony sensor.Our team of engineers are working all year long to provide regular software updates to always offer the best product on the market. In Vespera, several million tasks are processed between the moment the lens captures the starlight and the moment you see it on your mobile device.  AutofocusAs with any kind of photo, the focus is crucial in astronomy. The outside temperature changes during the night, so we developed the only astronomical instrument with autofocus that adjusts automatically for the entirety of your observation.Designed for wanderers, Vespera is the lightest and smallest smart telescope in the world. So tiny, it can fit in your backpack. Weighing less than 5 kgs, you can bring it with you everywhere to explore new places, and live even more unforgettable moments. We are proud to share the same passion as two legends of Space Exploration. Scott Kelly, former astronaut, pilot of Discovery space Shuttle, holds the record for the longest stay in Space in one mission. He also worked on the Hubble telescope. Terry Virts was commander of the ISS, and has the around-the-world speed record in 47 hours."I felt completely connected to the universe and I hope with Vespera, you can experience some of that feeling too". Scott Kelly."It's really a breakthrough, it's really a gem of technology I've never thought of until Vaonis made this amazing device." Terry Virts.Because this project couldn't exist without ❤️Agnès, Audrey, Benoit, Christophe, Cyril, Adrien, Nora, Gilles, Joy, Maxime, Mehdi, Mihai, Remy, Stéphanie, Thomas and Yann.  ❤️Thanks to APF, our manufacturer, and Ova design agency, our council design agency, Vespera's project went from drawing to reality.Together, we're ready to press the START button!A big thanks to L'Imagerie Films for their amazing work during this campaign.

record.Creator: Freedrum
record.Title: Freedrum 2: Our Next Virtual Drum Kit
record.Text: From $79 for Kickstarter backers.We're Freedrum and this is the most affordable way to learn and play the drums anytime, anywhere. By pledging from just $79 (Kickstarter discount) we'll give you everything you need to get started:1. Our new complete virtual drum kit that's silent and portable.2. A 3 month subscription to our app (iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows) that will teach you to play and much more.We love playing the drums but they're large, loud, and expensive. That's why we've created an instrument that's silent, portable, and significantly more affordable.Our solution is a complete hardware and software subscription service that will give you everything you need to start playing the drums.This tightly integrated relationship between instrument and app will transform the way that you practice and give you deeper insights into your improvements.LEARN TO PLAY ALONG TO MUSICOur app takes learning to a new level of fun. We will include a catalog of licensed music so that you can learn to play along with your favourite songs. Our software will show you what you should play and how well you are playing it.TRACK YOUR PROGRESS The activity analysis in our app removes the guesswork from tracking your progress. We'll summarise the following data in chronological order from each of your practice sessions so that it's easy to find and read:SHARE YOUR RECORDINGS  You'll have so much fun improving your skills that you won't be able to keep it to yourself. We're making recording the drums easier than ever before. Simply share your recordings with the Freedrum community in a few clicks.OUTPUT MIDI TO ANY DAWOnce you’re ready to take your drumming into production, output MIDI from our app to your favourite Digital Audio Workstation such as GarageBand, Ableton, and Pro Tools. You’ll be able to remap the MIDI so that you can:NEVER STOP LEARNINGEven the pro's never stop learning. Our service will grow with your confidence level and keep challenging you to be better. We'll recommend exercises that encourage improvement as well as retention of learned skills.HAPTIC FEEDBACK Nothing is going to replace the feeling of playing behind an acoustic drum kit but our new virtual drum kit will bring you closer. Haptic feedback (similar to what you feel with a game console controller) creates a unique sensation based on which drum you hit and how hard. We’ve done this by recreating the vibrations you feel when playing an acoustic kit.HEEL UPOne of the most requested features from our customers is the ability to play the bass pedal with your heel up: increasing your speed and comfort. This will work for single bass, double bass, and the hi-hat.CUSTOM GRIP STYLES  In our app you will be able to select your preferred drumstick grip style for both left and right-handed playing: intelligently re-calibrating the drumstick sensors to meet the ergonomic grip of your choice.It's our mission to make Freedrum compatible with as many devices as possible. As our name suggests, you should be free to use our product in a way that suits you best. Please refer to our FAQ for a full list of supported devices. Since Freedrum is using interactive audio, Bluetooth headphones and speakers have an inherent latency that makes it difficult to play. Please refer to our FAQ page for more information.Thanks to you, the community, our first virtual drum kit reached over 400% of the Kickstarter goal and we delivered our rewards, on time, 9 months later. Since 2017 we've shipped 15 000 units globally and we've listened to all of your feedback. We're back, four years later to ask for your help once more. Pledge to our project today and help us create the future of drumming for all.OUR TEAMNeed assets for press or social media? Here is the PRESS KIT LINK. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

record.Creator: Jianbo
record.Title: Clicbot | Your New Favorite Educational Robot
record.Text: Clicbot is your family’s newest friend. He listens, he thinks, and he even reacts. His personality is contagious, and his playful design makes him even more lovable. More than that, he’s an engaging teacher that knows how to make learning fun.Clicbot’s character and personality were designed by Carlos Baena, an award winning designer.Clicbot’s personality adjusts depending on how you build and code him- each setup (and there are more than 1000 setups) has its own unique combination of use cases, ensuring that Clicbot is forever-engaging and always fun.Clicbot is an entire universe. He’s got more than 1000 different setups, so you can build yours to climb, dance, crawl, drive, or even serve you your morning coffee.Clicbot has more than 200 reactions like nuzzling up to you when you pet him, trying to find you when you cover his eye, and getting excited when you put him in the charging station. There are two setups with predefined personalities according to their specific set ups- you don’t even need to code them.Clicbot starts super basic. Build your new robot and get a grasp on robotics by clicking pieces together. You can then assign movement directions by moving your Clicbot and selecting the direction in which its moving. Or you can record a sequence by simply hitting record and moving the bot. It’s that easy. Now you can play that sequence over and over- no code required.Upload your videos to the Clicbot community and browse videos from other users. Learn from others and let them learn from you- the perfect combination of creativity and education. Founded in 2014, KEYi Tech Ltd. is an innovative robotics company with strong competence in designing and developing STEAM Education robots in China. Our first-generation product, CellRobot was featured on Forbes, Digital trends, BBC, etc. In 2016, CellRobot was chosen as the "Best of CES" by BBC and won the championship in the 2017 Creative Business Cup in Copenhagen.Our team consists of top engineers and designers with working experiences from Pixar, Samsung, Intel and academic backgrounds from Tsinghua, BUAA and more. KEYi Tech owns more than 40 independent IPR ranging from robotic designs to AI algorithms, and our company has strong connections with China's top universities and enterprises.Clicbot is our second-generation product and we've been developing it for the last year-and-a-half with the goal of making breakthrough, modular education robots. Our industrial-level algorithms enable smoother and more natural robot movements, and the 200+ reactions really give Clicbot a personality.We hope to use this simple yet powerful product to deliver ultimate education values and bring smart robots to every family.  Tross is a data driven Crowdfunding company

record.Creator: UDOO
record.Title: UDOO Neo = Raspberry Pi + Arduino + Wi-Fi + BT 4.0 + Sensors
record.Text:
UDOO Neo  embodies a new concept: a single board computer suitable for the Post-PC era:Two years after the launch of UDOO, we are back! With UDOO we created a new playground for students to learn the basics of coding and electronics. Designers use UDOO as an artistic platform to build digital installations, interactive museums or new musical instruments. In these two years, Makers have hacked cars, built 3D printers and Android robots—all thanks to UDOO. Startups, businesses and research groups have prototyped Lunar Rovers, and augmented reality applications for museums and multimedia smart home applications. 
With UDOO Neo we want to take it one step further. In the next five years, connected devices will outnumber the global population, and we will be living in a whole new world of automatic interactions between smart objects: this is the Internet of Things. We designed UDOO Neo as the platform to bring you into this new world.Most Makers start with Raspberry Pi or Arduino™. We love them both, so we designed UDOO to merge these two worlds into one powerful solution. With UDOO Neo, we decided to take our bet further. 
Because we share the vision that a computer is not just a screen with a keyboard: it is a toolbox for hacking the world and building daring creative projects.UDOO Neo offers a new paradigm in the single board computer landscape: from homogeneous to heterogeneous processor. 

UDOO Neo embeds two cores on the same processor: a powerful 1GHz ARM Cortex-A9 and an exceptional 166MHz Cortex-M4 I/O real-time co-processor on the same chip, the Freescale i.MX 6SoloX. This is a heterogeneous processor.UDOO Neo is born to be wireless, featuring both a powerful Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n and a Bluetooth 4.0 module - Classic Bluetooth and Bluetooth Low Energy - to connect to nearby objects, smart and mobile devices like speakers, microphones, tablets, smartphones, smart watches, beacons, cameras, smart trackers, headphones, NAS devices, smart TVs, smart cars and many other wireless devices. 
UDOO Neo also embeds Wi-Fi Direct Smart Config. How does it work? It’s very simple: you connect your UDOO Neo to another device via a P2P connection, regardless of whether you have a wireless access point or not. Finally, with UDOO Neo you can always rely on fast ethernet RJ45 (10/100 Mbps).The Internet of Things is here, all around us. From smartphones to wearables, from smart appliances to M2M applications, sensors are everywhere, and bring a world of data about moving things into the online realm. UDOO Neo embeds 9-axis motion sensors (accelerometer, magnetometer, digital gyroscope) directly on the board. This way, you can build a drone that automatically adjusts to a perfectly stable horizontal position if there is wind. Or connect it to your motorbike and measure your riding skills, using it as a smart tracker for motorbikes.   The only limit is your creativity!Not to mention the compatibility with analog sensors. Temperature sensors, potentiometers, light resistors and many others sensors are analog, and most other boards are only compatible with digital sensors.UDOO Neo is a credit-card sized single board computer: our current prototypes are 59.3mm x 85mm (3.35" x 2.33"). UDOO Neo is indeed a pocket computer. Bring it with you wherever you go. Simply attach it to the USB port of your computer to power-it up. Alternatively, you can use an external battery to power it up, like you would with your smartphone.Otherwise, just attach it to a 12v power supply, a mouse and a keyboard through its USB ports or to your tv/monitor through the micro HDMI port, or LVDS touch display. We designed UDOO as an easy product to get started with. On UDOO Neo, thanks to the powerful Cortex-M4, you can run Arduino™ sketches using the standard  Arduino™ IDE. UDOO Neo is compatible with all the sketches, tutorials and resources available from the Arduino™ community. On UDOO Neo, thanks to the efficient Cortex-A9, you will be able to run both Android and Linux, and just by switching the SD Card, you can shift from Android to Linux in a flash. The UDOO Neo Kernel will be based on the Linux Kernel 3.10. We are developing a dedicated Ubuntu-based distro for UDOO Neo, like we did with UDOObuntu for UDOO. Since UDOO Neo is an open-source hardware project, we will release u-Boot and kernel sources. With the help of the community, we will release other distros in the following months, as we did for UDOO with XBMC, Linaro Ubuntu, ArchLinux, Debian, Yocto Project, Volumio, OpenMediaVault, Debian Wheezy armHF and Open Elec.  UDOO Neo supports Android Kitkat 4.4.3. It will be a Vanilla Android: an Android version without any customization, in order to allow you to fully customize.You will also be able to install Google Apps like Google Play, Chrome, Google Now, YouTube and so on. 
UDOO Neo is the perfect platform to program in the Cloud due to its unprecedented connectivity. However, we won't force you to use a proprietary cloud service. You can program locally, without staying connected or relying on proprietary servers. Or you can program in the Cloud. 
There are several open-source solutions online you can already use to program in the Cloud through UDOO Neo.When we designed UDOO, students and teachers were our first concern. Students deserve a quick and smart solution, while teachers need something interactive and easy to teach.UDOO Neo helps classrooms approach subjects like electronics, computer science, robotics or interaction design.Regardless of whether you're an expert or a beginner, UDOO Neo is the perfect tool for both beginning and advanced programming skills. On UDOO Neo, you can indeed write in any language you  already know. On our website, www.udoo.org, you'll find many step-by-step tutorials, structured for different levels of expertise, from beginner to advanced. If you are interested in electronics, UDOO Neo is also an exceptional starting point to start tinkering and get experienced with Arduino™ and circuitry. You can take any Arduino™ project from www.arduino.cc and build it on UDOO as if it were a wireless Arduino™!UDOO is already collaborating with many schools, like the Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, USA, ETH Zurich, Switzerland, MS Ramaiah Institute of Technology in Bangalore, India, University of Siena, Italy, the Sarrocchi Institute of Technology in Siena, Italy, and Malignani Institute of Technology in Udine, Italy, by giving students the chance to gain experience developing software, open source hardware and Internet of Things applications. Around UDOO, a vibrant community is growing and growing.  UDOO Neo, like UDOO, is an open-source hardware product, so all the schematics, gerber files and the BOM (bill of materials) will be available for hacking when the board is released. Being open-source is crucial to supporting our community. Thanks to its flexibility, UDOO Neo allows you to re-create any Arduino™ or Raspberry Pi projects you want.Each day, UDOOers meet each other in our forum, and exchange points of view and details about their current projects. We are proud of our community and the projects it has realized in these two years.UDOO is the result of a joint effort between SECO and AIDILAB. SECO designs and manufactures each product in the UDOO family. Relying on SECO means relying on a manufacturer with over 35 years of experience in the single board computer field, with an in-house manufacturing unit that has been an ISO9001 certified company since 2003. AIDILAB is an Interaction Design Lab of artists, designers and engineers focused on nurturing the UDOO community, building software and hardware applications for the UDOO family and spreading the open-source philosophy of UDOO around the world. Timeline

 So far, UDOO Neo has been developed as a rev A prototype. We are already working on the rev B prototype, figuring out the strengths and weaknesses of the model and experimenting on both the hardware and software sides. As soon as this prototyping step is finished, we will release UDOO Neo rev C to beta testers.

record.Creator: Aurea Technologies
record.Title: Shine: A Wind Turbine That Fits In Your Backpack
record.Text:
Thank you, Kickstarter! We've been absolutely blown away by all the support we've received from this incredible community and couldn't be more grateful. Pledge at the $5 high five level to join our backer community and you'll be the first to get notified about when our next batch of Shine units become available.In the meantime,  feel free to check out our awesome Shine accessories that are still available:HOW DO YOU POWER YOUR OUTDOOR ADVENTURES?Do you use portable power banks that die in a few hours,  solar chargers that rarely create usable power or bulky power stations that are hard to pack and heavy to carry?It’s time to ditch these. It’s time to use clean,  efficient wind energy to power your devices!The Shine Turbine is the ultra-compact, highly efficient, portable wind charger that lets you use the wind to rapidly create your own power to charge all your handheld devices - from your phone to your camera - anytime, anywhere the wind blows.From exploring coasts to navigating plains to scaling mountains, all you need to do is set up Shine and in under 2 minutes, you’ll have a wind generator to power your adventures. Charge phones, tablets, lights, cameras, and more with this small but mighty 40 W turbine. Power gear in real-time during the day or night, or rapidly store energy for later use with Shine’s internal 12,000 mAh Li-Ion battery.As CEO of A for Adventure, Chris promotes outdoor adventures through videography, photography, consultation, book readings and more. His team is based in beautiful Dartmouth, Nova Scotia.Access to renewable power off-grid is essential as electronics often require more charging power than portable batteries can provide. Without a reliable energy source, you can find yourself in vulnerable situations when your battery supply can’t be replenished.Whether you’re camping, canoeing, RVing, hanging at a cottage, or looking to prepare for an emergency, the Shine Turbine provides renewable power day and night, rain, cloud, or shine.Shine’s patent-pending technology instantly converts wind into power to charge a variety of devices or rapidly stores energy in its internal 12,000 mAh battery for later use. Plug a USB cable into Shine to power devices while the turbine is in operation or stowed. Plug your phone into Shine while at basecamp, or pack Shine up and continue to power devices while the turbine is stowed in your pack.This 40-watt ultra-compact wind charger can power any handheld USB device, including phones, tablets, lights, drones, cameras, GPS, speakers, e-readers, headphones, power banks, and more.Shine creates energy faster than any other handheld renewable product. It is able to collect three phones' worth of power in an hour at maximum rated wind speeds.Shine is for anyone who wants to charge handheld devices while disconnected from the energy grid. The turbine is perfect for keeping electronics charged while backpacking, camping, RVing, fishing, hunting, remote working, and more. Use Shine to charge just about any handheld device including:Use a USB-A power cord to charge your devices while at home, at camp, or on the move.HERE'S THE TIME IT TAKES SHINE TO PRODUCE THE POWER TO CHARGE POPULAR DEVICESShine’s high-efficiency blades and patent-pending technology allow it to rapidly create and store energy faster than any other handheld renewable energy product. The table above shows the power Shine will generate between the lowest and highest wind speeds the turbine can operate in. Even at 8 mph, which is hardly any wind with leaves on trees slightly moving, Shine will create usable power to trickle charge its internal battery. The turbine will generate large amounts of power in high wind speeds up to 28 mph and rapidly fully charge its internal battery.WIND SPEED MAP OF NORTH AMERICACheck out the open source Global Wind Atlas to see what kind of wind speeds you can expect to find at your favorite camping locations across the globe!PRO TIP: Hit up your campsite using the search bar on the wind map and click "10" meters on the bottom right  side bar for the most accurate wind speeds for Shine!START WITH THE WINDWind flows over the turbine body causing Shine to automatically turn into the wind. The wind turns the blades on the rotor which spins its generator, allowing its internal battery to charge.POWER ANYTIMEPower your device while Shine is in operation or stowed. No need to wait for a full charge, you can use your device while connected to Shine. And when it’s time to hit the trail, stow Shine in your backpack pocket and run the cable to your device for on-the-go charging. Shine is built for the rugged outdoors. Its monopod is made of highly-resilient 7075-T6 aluminum, its motor mount is made of aircraft-grade 6061-T6 aluminum, and its blades and body are made of injection-molded PC-ABS material.The Shine Turbine team has been developing the product since 2018 and has overcome countless technical hurdles. These ranged from optimizing the pivot point to face Shine into the wind, to fitting everything needed to set up the turbine inside its internal compartment, to its patent-pending turbine design that provides portability without sacrificing efficiency!SHINE GETS MORE POWER FROM NATUREShine’s major differentiator is its power generation efficiency. When it comes to generating high amounts of energy quickly, the wind wins! This is because the wind has a cubic relationship with power.Shine works on the cubic output of wind. That means as wind speeds double, Shine’s power output goes up eight times. This, paired with Shine’s high-efficiency blades and lightweight design, allow it to produce the most amount of energy for the least amount of weight compared to any other comparable portable renewable charger.What does this mean? Your new portable turbine is more efficient than other comparable wind turbines, river turbines, solar panels, and battery packs on the market!EVERYTHING NEEDED TO USE SHINE STOWS TO THE SIZE OF A WATER BOTTLEShine features an extremely compact design. The size of a water bottle, it can easily find a home in your pack's side pouch. Everything needed to set up the turbine stores inside its internal compartment, and its blades fold onto its body to make it 100% self-contained.The team behind Shine are all avid outdoor enthusiasts and have experienced the typical issues that come with portable solar chargers. At this size, solar panels are only about 5-10% efficient, especially if the sun is not directly above the panel. Meaning if there’s cloud, if it’s nighttime, or if there’s dust or dirt on the panel, very little power is going to be generated. Shine’s ability to provide energy at any time of day, in all different weather conditions, makes it a much more dependable source of power.Check out these "Shine-y" add-ons to use with the Shine Turbine and on your outdoor adventures! Choose your add-ons & accessories when you place your pledge, before entering your payment information. MECHANICAL SPECIFICATIONS ELECTRICAL SPECIFICATIONS PERFORMANCE SPECIFICATIONSHOW MUCH WIND DO I NEED?We are a team of outdoor enthusiasts with a love for renewable energy who wondered, “Why aren’t there more products that let people easily create their own wind power?”Well… as we discovered...it’s pretty complicated, but after three years of designing, testing and refining, we’ve figured it out!Born out of the belief that we need to rethink the ways in which we produce and use energy, we created the Shine Turbine. Shine is the first of a series of renewable power products that will provide freedom from the electrical grid.We’re ready to spin into production, and we need your help to make it happen. When you support Shine, you join our mission to provide clean energy independence. Your support will bring the future of portable wind power to life — it's as simple as that!AUREA TECHNOLOGIESAurea Technologies, the company behind Shine, is based in the coastal province of Nova Scotia, Canada, where there’s never a shortage of wind! 
YOUR SHINE TEAMThe Shine Turbine wouldn’t be where it is today without the incredible support from our partners and research teams:Find our press kit here.

record.Creator: QUBS
record.Title: CODY BLOCK: introducing coding one block at a time. Ages 3-9
record.Text:
Instagram | Facebook | Twitter | Press pack Hi! We are QUBS, a Swiss company, and we’re launching our first educational toy: Cody Block! Cody Block is a Montessori inspired, screen-free wooden toy for children 3+, introducing the basics of computational thinking through tangible programming.It’s a busy city! Go on adventures with Cody, help him find his way home by driving through the cityscape one block at a time! Create and learn the basics of coding, it’s hands on programming!Cody Block introduces the first concepts of computational thinking to young children via tangible programming. Your task is to lay out a path that leads Cody back to his house by positioning the Building Blocks in a correct order. Each Building Block gives a unique directional command (turn left, turn right, U turn, repeat last command, stop, record path, play path), together they create a sequence of instructions (the basis of any algorithm). Here is a short video showing a Cody in action.  In this video, Cody is going Left, Left, then makes a U turn to finally reach his home and stop!Cody Block comes with the City Guide, a story book with several exercises & adventures providing different learning outcomes.Children can play with Cody for hours without the need of any smartphone, laptop or screen. We have developed a specific RFID technology (patented!) that is embedded in every wooden block. Cody Block has been designed with gender equity in mind, it is as much fun for boys as for girls. Also, there are no written information on the toy, it’s ready to play even if your child does not read.The design of Cody Block takes its inspiration from classic wooden toys and the Montessori philosophy in its material and shape: solid beech wood and intuitive design. We intentionally did not incorporate light or sound, and there are no visible electronics. Just a moving car driving around the city blocks. Your city can be as big as you want, the Building Blocks can be set 20  cm, 50 cm, 1 meter, 10 meters apart! It’s all up to you and your imagination! And there are no limits to how many blocks and Cody car you can play with!In this digital age it is important to empower children to be creators and not only passive users of new technologies. The current generation of children will need to be literate in technology in order to understand the world they live in. Understanding how computers work and learning the basics of coding will not only help children to learn logical thinking but also to develop fundamental problem solving abilities, creativity and resilience. Learning these skills from an early stage creates a natural tendency to assimilate this content in a more efficient way. Cody helps introducing coding concepts to the little ones. But what will they learn? And how?Algorithm: An algorithm is a set of rules that define a sequence of operations. When children lay out the Building Blocks for Cody to follow, they are actually giving the computer rules on how and where to move.Sequencing: Sequencing is the specific order in which instructions are performed in an algorithm. It is important that the steps in an algorithm are performed in the correct order - otherwise the algorithm will not work. In the same way Cody follows the order of the Building Blocks: if one Block is misplaced or there’s a gap in the sequence, Cody will go in the wrong direction.

Debugging: Mistakes in code are called ‘bugs.’ Debugging is a process that includes identifying the problem and then correcting it. Because the Building Blocks are tangible and arranged on a surface for the children to see, it is easier for them to spot the mistake in their code and debug the program.Function: A function is a part of code that can be called by another part of the program. With Cody, kids can create a function and record it with Cody. Cody will remember that function and perform it again in the code every time he encounters a “Play Function” Block.Logic: Learning the thinking behind coding teaches children how to tackle large problems by breaking them down into a sequence of smaller, more manageable problems. This logical thinking skill is a powerful tool that can be used in every field and in real life too! We chose to create a tangible programming language that kids can actually touch with their hands, following the Montessori proposition that kids learn best by experiencing the environment around them. The Cody Block set comes with:  Cody always drives in a straight line and only changes direction or stops when it faces a Building. You can’t drive without a driver, so to turn Cody ON, simply snap his head and body together (we are using magnets!).There are 7 different Buidling Blocks, each gives a specific order to Cody. Each Cody Block set comes with 16 Building Blocks in total.Here is an interview from Bruce Lamont, a primary school teacher and a Lead Teacher in Zurich with 32 years of experience: You might wonder how Cody detects the instruction commands from the blocks. We are not using any camera recognition. Instead we are using a piece of technology called RFID (Radio-Frequency-Identification). In short, it consists of an antenna (inside Cody) emitting an electromagnetic field in order to detect a tag (inside the blocks) with a unique identification. RFID is commonly used in the industry (contactless payment, door pass, etc.) but it was a challenge to develop that technology to meet Cody Block requirements. We are very proud to say that our use of RFID technology in Cody Block is patented! And don’t worry, the radio frequency we are using is of course safe for your children. The other advantage with RFID technology is that it means Cody only needs batteries to power up (4 x AA batteries). It works straight out of the box. No Bluetooth, no Wifi required. The Building Blocks are literally just a wooden block with a little tag embedded in it.Cody Block has been designed by Studio Oscar Lhermitte, a multidisciplinary design studio based in Paris & London. The studio developed the product with these factors in mind: being playful, intuitive while at the same time being a beautiful little wooden toy with a life of its own. All the illustration work was created by the talented illustrator, João Fazenda. We hope you love it as much as we do! As well as thinking hard about the way Cody Block looks and feels, we’ve spent a huge amount of time on the engineering side of it. The mechanics, electronics & software development were engineered by Studio Christophe Machet and Studio Peter Krige, respectively. QUBS is a Swiss company, but our team is all over Europe!We are a new company, Cody Block is our first toy and we have big ambitions with it. We are launching it on Kickstarter because we want to raise the necessary funds to start the production of the first batch of 1 000 units. We have done extensive work development on it and are asking you to join us in this journey from now until production and fulfillment. We are also very eager to build a community of early adopters, get feedback and learn from you so we can develop Cody Block even better. Several of our partners/collaborators have had extensive experience with Kickstarter and they all told us it was clear to them that Cody Block should be launched on Kickstarter.We have our manufacturer secured and have pricing agreement with them. They have been behind several successful products that were launched on Kickstarter and they have done extensive work on toys in general. The funds raised on Kickstarter will go towards:We are aware of the complexity of manufacturing a product and delivering it to the backers. We are confident we have built the right team with the best expertise. The timeline below shows the milestones from now until completion.Thank you so much for reading this far! ;-) We could not be here and have done such work without the contribution of fantastic people, so special thanks to: Rolv-Erik Spilling, Tim Schindel, Bernd Gottwald, Bruce Lamont, Oscar Lhermitte, Federica Orlati, Peter Krige, Christophe Machet, Joao Fazenda, Sophie Demay, Maël Fournier - Comte, Arthur Lhermitte, Elisa Bertron, the whole team at Sidekick Creatives, Solange & Arnaud, Margaux & Hadrien, Marine & Matt, Amandine & Aïssa, Rokhia and Ytaly.

record.Creator: Tidbyt, Inc.
record.Title: Tidbyt: The Retro Display from the Future
record.Text: Hey, we're Mats and Rohan, the creators of Tidbyt. We've built a new way to keep up with the things you care about.Use Tidbyt to check the weather, or when your train is arriving. Track your favorite stock tickers, or your Dogecoin holdings 🐶  Browse our steadily growing collection of apps and choose what matters to you.Tidbyt comes in a solid walnut enclosure and looks pretty great on your desk or bookshelf. Set it up once with your phone, and it stays updated through its own Wi-Fi connection. Tidbyt can display pretty much anything, as long as it fits on the screen. Here's what we've got or are working on so far:We're always adding more features. Let us know what you'd like to see and we can work on it! And if you'd like to add stuff yourself, you can write a bit of code to push new things to the Tidbyt through its API. Every Tidbyt is unique, and with the Tidbyt app, you can schedule what you want to see and when. Your subway stop every morning? Got it. Your calendar throughout the day? Done.Tidbyt will cycle through the apps you select, one at a time. They can be scheduled to run at different times if you wish, or all at once. And if you want to keep it by your bed, Tidbyt's Night Mode can make the display go ultra-dim so it doesn't bother you while you sleep.Here's a quick demonstration of how all of this works—You can choose multiple apps to be displayed on your Tidbyt at the same time. It will cycle or rotate through, displaying each of them for either 5, 10 or 15 seconds (you pick). Easily cycle through multiple stock tickers, time and weather in different cities, multiple subway stops, a bunch of fun messages, or all of the above.Tidbyt lets you schedule apps to only be shown at certain times. Use your phone to choose what you want displayed and when.Tidbyt can get really, really bright if you want it to! But sometimes that's not what you want, so we built some great ways to control how bright your Tidbyt is.Adjustable BrightnessUse your phone to adjust the brightness of your Tidbyt.  Choose the brightness level that works best for the room your Tidbyt is in, whether it's in a basement or right next to a window.Night ModeKeeping a Tidbyt by your bed? Then Night Mode is for you. Choose your bedtime and we'll make the display very, very dim so that it doesn't bother you while you sleep. We also turn off all your normal Tidbyt apps and just show a simple clock, in case you wake up and want to know what time it is.Follow the Sun With auto-dimming, Tidbyt automatically adjusts its brightness as the sun rises and sets. It'll remain at your selected brightness level during the day, and gradually go dimmer as the sun sets in the evening.We built Tidbyt to be an open platform, so you can build your own applets and experiences for your Tidbyt. If you can write a bit of Python, then Tidbyt gives you super powers.With our existing API and SDK, you can build your own in minutes. Write whatever you'd like and push it to your Tidbyt to be displayed instantly.Later this year, we'll be launching a platform for any developer to publish new apps for Tidbyt. In fact, some early Tidbyt owners have already been coming up with fun new uses for their devices:If you're more of a hardware hacker, you can plug into our open hardware to customize your Tidbyt even further.  We're building a firmware development kit that you can use to build firmware and customize the functionality of your Tidbyt down to the very last byte.Early last year, we quit our jobs to start building Tidbyts in our workshop, and shipping them out as part of a pilot program. We assembled them by hand, and shipped them to friends, family, and other early adopters. Here's what some of them have had to say. You can also check out our community, where several of our users have been suggesting new features and discussing their own DIY app ideas.The feedback we've received has been invaluable, and we've improved the product quite a bit during the year. Now, we're scaling up our manufacturing to produce enough Tidbyts for everyone. We've partnered with a factory that can produce Tidbyts by the hundreds, though we need to place a large enough order to kick things off. With your support, we're hoping to do just that.Tidbyt is ready to go — we've tested out our manufacturing process, built the software, and successfully shipped units in our early access program. Based on this, we believe that it will take about 8-10 weeks to manufacture a batch of Tidbyts. We're also building in some additional time because the American walnut hardwood we're using is in very high demand and our supplier has a backlog.We'll then be bringing the Tidbyts from the factory in Shenzhen to the USA, for final shipping and delivery. Due to shipping volatility during the pandemic, the import & delivery process can take as long as two months. Given that, we're estimating delivery in September (though we'll definitely try to do everything we can to deliver earlier, if it's possible).🇺🇸  We'll be shipping using UPS and USPS from a US warehouse. We expect most backers in the US to receive their Tidbyt within 2-3 days of it being shipped.International deliveries will be sent duty unpaid. This means that if you are ordering a Tidbyt outside the US, you may owe duty, VAT, or other taxes, based on your local regulations. These taxes legally have to be paid when you receive the package, or it may be returned to us or even destroyed 😟 Note that there may be minor changes to the specs as we ramp up production. In particular, the exact dimensions of the enclosure may differ a bit.To set up and configure your Tidbyt, you'll be using our smartphone app, which requires iOS or Android.Tidbyt, Inc., was founded in early 2020 by Rohan and Mats, who both quit their jobs to focus full-time on this nifty little idea. The two met in 2011 while working for Spotify in Stockholm, Sweden, and currently both reside in Brooklyn, New York.You can find our Press Kit over here.Our campaign video was produced by the very talented people at FnA.Our creative and brand design was done by Hea Jin Ko.For web design and marketing help, we couldn't have done it without Aiko Takemura.We got a lot of amazing advice and help planning our launch from the friendly folks at Launch Studio:

record.Creator: YOLK
record.Title: Solar Cow, Send Underprivileged Kids to School.
record.Text: How does it work? The Solar Cow – one of Time Magazine’s top 100 inventions of 2019 – is a solar charging system installed in schools in rural off-grid areas in African countries, with a current focus in Tanzania. Solar Cows allow kids to charge portable batteries, called Solar Milk, while they attend class and take them home at the end of the school day. It becomes valuable source of energy for charging parents' cell phone and light at night.Many low-income families rely on kerosene lighting and relatively expensive charging stations to meet their energy needs, this green electricity is a tangible incentive for them to send their kids to school instead of work. The energy budget of the average Kenyan household takes up to 15% of their monthly income, so saving money on electricity is a great benefit. Meeting families’ short-term energy needs also helps them to break out of poverty in the long term by providing kids with an education, creating fundamental change in their lives. Education enables people to improve their own lives, instead of relying on external assistance.  YOLK developed a custom charging socket that is only compatible with Solar Cow charging systems so that parents must send kids to school in order to charge their battery. This also helps to prevent misallocation of the batteries for other uses. For our Kickstarter backers, we will send Solar Milk that can be charged through regular USB-C so you can use it at home.Backers will be able to access the PDF file for a certificate of Wocralos on Dec 24th. You can share the story with your loved ones about your special gift for them.Changing the world for the better seems like a daunting task but Solar Cow is here to make it just a bit easier. How great would it be if kids can go to school and enjoy more days full of fun with their friends? Thanks to Solar Cow,  now they even have power to play songs and dance together~!!! What’s more, backers who select the Give + data option will be shown data on kids' charging of their Solar Milk. Each battery given to kids in Tanzania has a unique ID code, which the Solar Cow records every time it is used. This allows supporters to see the real impact of their purchase for a better world. With Kickstarter funding, we will be able to launch this very new project concept to track the impact of Solar Milk and Solar Cows. Delivering individual and real data of users in Africa directly to backers is something that no other project has yet tried.YOLK has received widespread media coverage and several awards for Solar Cows, including from Time Magazine, an innovation award from the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), and placing in the top three at the Green Tech Awards, all in 2019. In 2018, we also won the aid innovation challenge at AidEx, as well as the iF Social Impact award. Our grants and partnerships include the P4G Partnership Award, the Korea International Cooperation Agency Creative Technology Solution Program, and a partnership with Energy4Impact.Solar Milk is a handy light and power bank that anyone can use. It makes an excellent night or flashlight, with four hours of bright light per charge, or six hours of soft light. It can also be used as a power bank to charge cell phones.Remember, as well as giving power to your phone, Solar Milk is also designed to empower kids in Tanzania to go to school. When you buy a Solar Milk battery and light for yourself,  you can also buy the same device for a child in Africa. While you can charge Solar Milk using a USB-C charger at home, African kids charge them at special solar charging systems, called Solar Cows, which are installed in schools.Easy turn on/off and mode change between mood light and torch.  This bright little gift tells a story of love. Share the Solar Cow story with family and friends.Our two prototype tests, in Kenya and Tanzania, proved so effective in increasing African kids' attendance rates, it was almost as though they were brought to school by magic!"I was particularly impressed by the increased attendance and retention rates that the Solar Cow initiative achieved [at a pilot project in Tanzania]; the increase in students' study time; and, the environmentally friendly nature of the  Its feature could enhance the results of UNESCO's own initiatives." -Tirso Dos Santos, Head of Office and Representative of UNESCO TanzaniaThis project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.About YOLKYOLK, the creator of Solar Cows, is a US and South Korea-based solar technology startup in the business of creating a symbiotic world through innovation. Nowadays, technology is evolving rapidly. However there are still so many people who are left out. For an example, there are 1.3bn people using Kerosene oil for light, which creates toxic emissions that are not only harmful to their health but also contribute to climate change.  What if we support people in developing countries to live better lives? Solar Cows can make the world a better place, not only in terms of the environment but also in terms of warmth and love. Team members YOLK founder and CEO Sen Chang is an award-winning designer whose recognitions include the iF and Red dot design award. After graduating from the Art Institute of Chicago with a bachelor of fine arts degree in designed objects,  she founded YOLK in 2015.Others in the YOLK team include engineering experts with more than 30 years of experience in the power industry, a professor with extensive international development experience, and a project manager with a decade of experience in developing countries, including in the solar technology field. Our team also includes local staff with experience in working for various NGOs on the ground. We also have  marketing experts to help us tell the story of Solar Cows to the world.Achievements YOLK raised over $1m on Kickstarter for Solar Paper, the world’s thinnest and lightest solar panel, with 6,000 backers, Solar Paper was featured by over 300 media outlets, and won the 2017 CES Innovation Award. Check out feedback from previous backers.

record.Creator: Jared Bouck
record.Title: Zcapture - Open Source 360 Product Photography
record.Text:
My goal with Zcapture is to provide a low-cost, high-quality product that can be modified, hacked or customized to fit individual needs. We believe this product should be shared with the world in a manner that is disruptive to this emerging industry of 360 driven content creation, shows a better way of doing things, and provides information in a user centric medium.I have been deeply involved in web development for 15 years and a great majority of that time has been focused on eCommerce development and design. In that time I have always found that the lack of meaningful product information is a killer when presenting a product in a meaningful way to have them purchase. Couple this experience with being a hard core maker that has been publishing articles for the last decade and there was bound to be a merging of ideas.The humble beginnings of Zcapture came from my own personal interest in experimentation about 8 years ago with Basic Stamp programming. Roughly 4 years ago I discovered the Arduino NG and fell in love with the Arduino platform from the point of view that anyone could learn it and use it. Immediately I set to work to build and refine the Zcapture system based on this robust platform. You can learn more about out mission and features in depth at our websiteAs a maker I have always been challenged with providing enough detail for a project guide while being able to see a project through to completion and publication. As the web has evolved the expectation of the user for better and better content has increased with the capability of browsers and web coding technologies.Coupling this concept with ecommerce and product information sites is a potent mix that is becoming more and more common. Leading the pack is Google and Wal-Mart venturing into the 360 product visualization sphere because of one simple reason, it sells. With the ability to see the product online and virtually handle it, people are more confident in their purchase and more likely to buy from a vendor with rich media.We’ve been able to produce the perfect system that rivals emerging competing products in the marketplace by coupling open source hardware design with the innovative application of technology, software, engineering, and above all creativity.This KickStarter is step one on a journey for us that ultimately leads to a boxed product that we would like to see be at a price point and availability that would enable anyone to be able purchase one. In our ideal situation we would like to see people using this to list products on auction sites, classifieds ads, and especially in the maker community to showcase their projects.The Zcapture system consists of three tightly integrated components: Hardware, Software, and HTML. These three systems allow you to easily go from item to website in as little as 15 minutes. The design and functionality of each system has been designed to be as easy to implement as possible with intuitive controls so that just about anyone can setup, connect, and shoot amazing 360 shots.While developing the Zcapture hardware platform, we went through several revisions. We wanted to produce something that was strong and robust while still staying cost-effective and reliable. This refining process has often been tumultuous because we are constantly adding new capabilities, features, and functionality to the system. At the same time, we are focused on producing something that will meet most people’s needs. This hardware platform has been designed to work 100% autonomously without the need to be connected or controlled from a computer or can be connected for a more seamless user experience within the Zcaptue software suite. Jared Bouck is the inventor, designer and creator of the Zcapture system and related Rotate 360 Studios that offers 360 photography services utilizing Zcapture technology. Jared has been involved as an active contributor in the maker / hacker / Tech oriented art communities for over a decade. He is an entrepreneur, multiple business owner, father and inventor.He is the author of several geek and tech oriented website like InventGeek.com, Algaegeek.com, Armorgeek.com, Zcapture.com, and has been published in many blogs and magazines the world over like MAKE magazine, PC magazine, Popular Science Big Book of Hacks, Hardcore Gamer, Toms Hardware, Makezine.com and, Hackaday.com to name a few. This is Jared's second KickStarter after successfully completing his last one. He is an avid inventor and creator, designing products, kits and projects for the DIY community to share and invites others to participate in all his projects.ManufacturingAll of our manufacturing will be done in house using our own manufacturing equipment that we already own. Our large laser cutter will be put to work to produce the chassis and disks for the system. We have an injection molding company on standby if we hit our stretch goals.Circuit boards are sourced from overseas with backup manufactures here in the US. Component parts are sourced from Newark and mouser with motors and power supplies directly from the manufacturers. We have 4 dedicated staff members to help handle assembly and shipping. We have 100 complete systems already sourced and we are front loading already.
